verbose_text: A common way to improve catalytic performance is then to decrease the size of the microporous domains, for instance, by using smaller zeolite crystals25 or to introduce additional intra- or intercrystalline porosity in zeolites.26 The latter solution has been followed in a wide variety of approaches, and methanol conversion has been a stock reaction in demonstrating the improved performance in terms of a decreased rate of deactivation, most evidently from the increased amount of methanol converted before the zeolite micropores become blocked.
